cui_name: Congenital Lipomatous Overgrowth, Vascular Malformations, and Epidermal Nevi
reasoning: CLOVEN syndrome is an extremely rare congenital condition characterized by lipomatous overgrowth, vascular malformations, and epidermal nevi. Fewer than 15 cases reported in medical literature as of 2020. Estimated incidence <0.001 per 100k births. Clinical presentation highly variable, may be underdiagnosed.
